title: Policy making by the federal courts

content.question: To influence policy making by the federal courts, the president may do all of the following EXCEPT

choices.label: take partisanship into account in making judicial appointments
take political ideology into account in making judicial appointments
make public statements about issues that might appear before the courts
encourage the Justice Department to get involved in cases that test certain issues

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
